Constructor Detail

Racket

public Racket()
Constructor for objects of class Racket

Method Detail

getImage

public java.awt.Image getImage()
Returns the racket's image

getRect

java.awt.Rectangle getRect()
Returns a rectangle that represents the racket's image. To mimic how a birdie hits the middle netted part of the racket, the rectangle is slightly lower than it normally would be if it represented the image itself.

getX

public int getX()
Returns x value of the racket

getY

public int getY()
Returns y value of the racket

keyPressed

public void keyPressed(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
The racket moves the user. Pressing the left key causes the racket to move to the left 3 units. Pressing the right key causes the racket to move to the right 3 units.

keyReleased

public void keyReleased(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
Once the key is released, the racket stops moving

move

public void move()
Moves the racket by adding the dx to the x position. Ensures that the racket doesn't move past the left and right edge of the court.
